Atari and Plaion have announced that they’ll be following up on their Atari 2600+ console with another re-issue from their classic line. This one is the Atari 7800+, based on the 1986(ish) console.


Now, if you’re like me, you’re probably wondering what the point is. After all, the Atari 2600+ already plays Atari 7800 games. While the Atari 7800+ comes with a wireless version of the CX78 gamepad, it doesn’t seem BlueTooth is a feature of the console. The controller connects to a wireless DB9 adapter, which means it also works with Atari 2600+ and even original hardware (and possibly other platforms that use DB9, such as the Commodore 64 and Sega Master System, but this isn’t confirmed). There were only 59 games released during the console’s original lifespan, and it isn’t nearly as ubiqui…
articles.title: Atari to continue its line of console resurrections with the Atari 7800+ because why not?

Screenshot by Destructoid

The reason you will need Luojia Fragrant Vine is that it is used to upgrade your healing Gourd, allowing you to take more sips from the vessel before it is empty. You can then bring t…

articles.description:
In Chapter 3 of Black Myth: Wukong, you will arrive at the terrifying Pagoda. This place is spooky, and there are a lot of folks here who'd like you to open the purple, locked cell doors. This is how to do it.


How to open the purple prison cells in the Pagoda in Black Myth: Wukong


To open the purple doors you will need to find and defeat Captain Lotus Vision, a secret boss hidden away in the level. When you do, you will be able to absorb his spirit, and the doors will open. This will allow you to get in and talk to the NPC at the start, as well as check all the locked rooms in the Pagoda to see what is inside.


To find Captain Lotus Vision, make your way through the Pagoda, climbing from level to level until you reach the Upper Pagoda Shrine. It is worth being quite thorough as you go…

Developer Arrowhead Game Studios has pushed out Helldivers 2 Patch 01.001.004 this week to address feedback it received following the game's Escalation of Freedom update. While the patch hits at least one point of player concern, it doesn't even touch the weapon nerfs. 


The patch notes for this update are short and concise. Among the most impactful changes is a fix for the explosions caused by the Impaler's tentacles, which have been causing Helldivers 2 players to be thrown 100 meters into the sky of whatever world they're on and furiously ragdoll before crashing back down and dying. The last update made flamethrowers far less effective, but this one fixes the particles that didn't affect enemies alongside allowing all players to detonate mines when enemies get close to them with their …
articles.title: Helldivers 2 Patch 01.001.004 fixes flamethrower particles, refines Impaler and explosion radiuses

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
In Sandgate village, surrounded by enemies and seemingly in a bit of a bind, you will meet a familiar face in Black Myth: Wukong. But can you help him out?


Can you free the horse man at the Village in Black Myth: Wukong


When you arrive at the Sandgate Village and finally make your way inside (I'd suggest going around to the right, as it's a bit easier, and then you get to ambush the guards at the gate), you will find a familiar face. The horseman whom you met in Black Wind Mountain is in there, and he is a bit of a pickle.


The rats have tied him to a pillar, and it would appear they plan on turning him into dinner for their master. If you are wondering if there is anything you can do to help the horseman out, there does not seem to be. He is content with the idea that he can get himself out of that mess and seems more worried about your safety than his own.


All you can really do is explore the area. There are some chests and a boss to fight, and if you open the gate, you can ambush the guards and get yourself a nice Spirit for your trouble.


Story spoilers ahead


The Horse Guai will show up in other locations throughout the game, and his real name is Ma Tianba. I want to try and help you find this chap in each chapter without actually ruining too much, so you can find some brief locations below.



Chapter 1 - Found just after the fight against the wolf demon Lingxuzi in a small shrine.


Chapter 2 - Sandgate Village, tied to a pole


Chapter 3 - Can be found in the New Thunderclap Temple


Chapter 4 - After the Centipede boss, you can find him all bundled up in a cocoon.


Chapter 5 - Can be found near the Misty Cloud fight.


The post Can you free the Horse Guai at the Sandgate Village in Black Myth: Wukong? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Can you free the Horse Guai at the Sandgate Village in Black Myth: Wukong?

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
No Man’s Sky patch 5.05 has just dropped, bringing a ton of bug fixes to improve the stability and fix crashes in the game. Among the many fixes, one stands out which was a bug that was causing the Liquidators part blueprints from showing up in some player’s main saves.


For context, finishing the Liquidators expedition, or any past No Man’s Sky expedition, rewards players with different rewards, and players can take the upgrades, technology and resources they’ve gathered in the expedition save back to their main save to continue enjoying them.


The major reward for the current No Man’s Sky Liquidators expedition is the Liquidator Minotaur, which is basically a mech that can be used for combat. Throughout the expedition, players earn several blueprints for the Liquidator Minotaur’s limbs which can be built to create the unique Minotaur.


Image via Hello Games


However, upon completion of the expedition and transferring items, players were not able to install the Liquidator Minotaur limbs in their existing saves. This issue has now been fixed by developer Hello Games, so if the blueprints were missing, you will now find them once you update No Man’s Sky.


There are also several other fixes including an issue that prevented Longshore S-Wing and Longshore C-Wing ship parts from being extracted when players were dismantling Haulers.


Docking at spherical space stations has been improved. Another key highlight of No Man's Sky patch today is that the game now supports up to eight mouse buttons, allowing players more options for remapping their controls. No Man's Sky VR players would also be delighted to know that the team has made efforts to reduce VRAM requirements to run the game in VR, so there should ideally be better performance and less stress on the hardware while playing No Man's Sky VR.


You can also check out the complete No Man’s Sky Update 5.05 patch notes.

The post No Man’s Sky Patch 5.05 fixes bug preventing Liquidator Minotaur blueprints from showing up in main save appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: No Man’s Sky Patch 5.05 fixes bug preventing Liquidator Minotaur blueprints from showing up in main save

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
No Man’s Sky is currently on Expedition 14 called The Liquidators which is part of the massive Worlds Part I update. With five phases to complete, each with its own set of milestones and rewards, there’s fresh content currently in the game for players, even as the game enters its eighth year since its release in 2016. The free expedition takes players to various planets where they must eliminate swarms of vile broods and other biological horrors.


Speaking of other biological horrors, one of the milestones requires players to go predator-hunting deep into the oceans. The Blood in the Water milestone is likely going to take some extra effort from players during the No Man’s Sky Liquidators expedition. While most of the other milestones are pretty self-explanatory, the Blood in the Water ca…
articles.title: No Man’s Sky Liquidator Expedition: How to complete Blood in the Water milestone

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
As you explore the Yellow Wind Ridge in Black Myth: Wukong, you will come to a falling wall of sand. If you have no means to get past it, this guide will help you out.


How to pass the falling wall of sand in Black Myth: Wukong


The falling wall of sand can be found to the right of the Rockrest Flat Shrine in the Yellow Wind Ridge area. As you approach it, you will find yourself stopped by an invisible barrier that ripples a little as you push against it. The only way to get through the barrier is if you have an item called the Loong Scales.


To get the Loong Scales, you need to play through the game until you reach the fight against the First Prince of Flowing Sands near the Valley of Despair Shrine. When you are you are fighting him, try to get him to crash into the ornate wall. If yo…
articles.title: How to pass the falling wall of sand in Black Myth: Wukong

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
The latest expedition in No Man’s Sky is the Liquidators which takes players on a journey to multiple star systems to join hands with the Liquidator Vanguard in their quest to defeat swarms of biological horrors from the galaxy.


This No Man's Sky expedition is split up into five phases, each with its own set of milestones to complete for rewards. While most of the milestones should not cause you much trouble and have pretty straightforward steps, there are some challenges which could potentially eat up hours of time if players are not looking in the right direction.


One such challenge is the Apex Predator milestone in Phase 3. It requires players to find, scan and analyse a predator creator that has aggression levels over 12.0 pav in No Man's Sky. Upon completing this objective, player…
articles.title: How to complete Apex Predator milestone in No Man’s Sky Liquidator expansion

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
There are a whole lot of boss fights in Black Myth: Wukong, but could I interest you in some secret ones? To get access to these, you will need the Loong Scales, and this is where to get them.


Where to find the Loong Scales in Black Myth: Wukong


To get the Loong Scales, you need to play through the game until you reach the fight against the Second Prince of Flowing Sands near the Sandgate Village. Once this is over, you can activate the Valley of Despair Shrine. Head into the cave nearby, and this will bring you to yet another boss fight.


The complicated affairs of the Royal Family of Flowing Sands will play out, leaving you to fight the First Prince of FLowing Sands, the brother of the creature you just defeated. As you fight him, attempt to lure him into the ornate wall on one side of the arena. If you can get him to charge it, he will crack it, creating a hole you can get into after the fight is complete.


Screenshot by Destructoid


If he doesn't crack it, then you can use the Wandering Wight Spirit to get inside via the awesome power of a mighty headbutt. Make your way through the wall, and you will find the Loong Scales in a golden chest. I have not been able to try it myself, but the Azure Dust Transformation Spell from the Man In Stone merchant is also a way to get through.


Now, I am not sure about all the boss locations for this just yet, but so far, I have found the following:



Chapter 1 - at the waterfall on the western side of the Forest. Spawn at the Outside the Forest Shrine, then move to the opposite side of the area where you fight the Wandering Wight. (Thanks for the heads up, Tom!)


Chapter 2 - The second one can be found behind the "sandfall" to the right of the Rockcrest Flat Shrine in the Yellow Wind Ridge region.


The post Where to find the Loong Scales in Black Myth: Wukong appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Where to find the Loong Scales in Black Myth: Wukong

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
If you play your cards right, Guangzhi will be the first boss fight you run into in Black Myth: Wukong. This unfortunate creature began life as a wolf but yearned to be so much more. This is how to beat him.


How to beat Guangzhi in Black Myth: Wukong


The key to beating any boss in Black Myth: Wukong is to understand their moveset. If you are not surprised by the things they do, you can easily control the fight. It is worth highlighting here one of the largest differences between early Black Myth: Wukong gameplay and other similar games. If you over-commit, you are dead. Definitely don't spam the dodge button, and don't spam heavy attacks. If you get caught up in those animations, you are gonna lose a lot of health.


Another thing to keep in mind about Guangzhi is that he will build up…
articles.title: How to beat Guangzhi in Black Myth: Wukong

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
Lingxuzi is the first really monstrous-sized boss you will run into in Black Myth: Wukong. He is guarding the ruins of an old temple, so prepare to say your prayers while you fight for your life.


How to beat Lingxuzi in Black Myth: Wukong


You can find Lingxuzi, the wolf demon, at the Guanyin Temple in Black Myth: Wukong. Honestly, he is not a particularly tough fight because of one major consideration that the devs have taken into account when designing his moves.


Unlike some bosses in other games, this guy spends a lot of his time repositioning. It means some very nice damage windows. He also appears to have been designed to try to stay away from the outside of the arena, so he never really tries to push you into a corner through raw aggression. Not every boss in the game will affor…
articles.title: How to beat Lingxuzi in Black Myth: Wukong

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
The Wandering Wight is a tough enemy that you will run into early in Black Myth: Wukong. This is how to fell the forsaken monk. 


How to beat the Wandering Wight in Black Myth: Wukong


If you want to fight this guy early, then feel free, but it is not actually necessary to do so. He will drop an item you won't even be able to pick until you have the Spirit upgrade for your Gourd, and you can just sneak around him if you want to. That said, if you want to kick his butt, there are some patterns you should really watch out for.



Fire is pretty good against this guy, so if you wish, go and face Guangzhi first. You will earn an interesting ability when you defeat him, which will be very useful in this fight, giving you access to a powerful spell that transforms you into Guangzhi, giving you…
articles.title: How to beat the Wandering Wight in Black Myth: Wukong

articles.author: Aidan O'Brien
articles.description:
While exploring Squall Hideout near Fright Cliff in Black Myth Wukong, you may come across a man trapped in stone. You can help him out, but be careful, because he is a tricky little devil.


How to help the man trapped in the rock in Black Myth: Wukong


You can find the man trapped in stone in a ravine just at the foot of the scaffolding on the right side of the Fright Cliff area, near the Squall Hideout. Drop down and talk to him, but beware, as the drop can take quite a bit of health.


After you speak to him, he will tell you that he has been imprisoned in the terrible rock and that all around him are cursed stone monsters. He is not wrong about that last bit, so be careful as you explore the area. To free the man, you will need to go and fetch an item from a nearby boss, although it …
articles.title: How to help the man trapped in the rock in Black Myth: Wukong – Man In Stone

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Bypass Paywalls Clean, a popular browser extension that allows users to view subscription websites without a subscription, has been shut down along with 3,879 forks. In a takedown notice filed at GitHub, News Media Alliance, which represents 2,200 news, magazine, and digital media publishers, explains that BPC violates its members rights under the DMCA's anti-circumvention provisions.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bypass Paywalls Clean Shut Down For DMCA Anti-Circumvention Violations

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Creative Content Australia has new anti-piracy campaign underway alongside the release of its annual Piracy Behaviors and Attitudes survey. In line with current anti-piracy trends, the group hopes to draw attention to the downsides of using pirate sites. "More than two million Australians who admit to visiting illegal streaming sites or pirate sites say they’ve experienced a form of online crime." Let's take a closer look.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Aussie Piracy Survey: ‘Poor Picture’ & ‘Slow Device’ = Cybersecurity Issues

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
U.S. law enforcement authorities appear to have seized several domain names of live sports streaming site Streameast, which is particularly popular in America. A seizure banner accuses the operation of criminal activity and warns of prison sentences. Nevertheless, the site's operators have already made a restart and are vowing to keep going until sports streams are affordable for everyone.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Feds Seize Domain Names of Sports Streaming Site Streameast

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Twisters' tops the chart, followed by 'Jackpot!'. 'Fly Me To The Moon' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 08/19/2024

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Almost two years after Radiohead released 'In Rainbows' as a pay-what-you-like album, the track 'These Are My Twisted Words' leaked on private torrent site What.cd. Many believed that the band itself was responsible, something we highlighted in our August 2009 article. Coinciding almost perfectly with the leak's 15-year anniversary, a complaint filed with Google now claims that the report violates copyright law and must be permanently deindexed from search results.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Radiohead ‘Leaked’ Their Own Track in 2009, Now We’re Accused of Pirating It

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
NVIDIA sits front and center of the AI boom. The company provides the much-needed chips and offers its own AI models. NVIDIA admittedly used pirated books to train these models, which triggered a copyright infringement lawsuit. This week, the company informed the court that these claims fall flat, arguing that copyrighted books are nothing more than statistical correlations to its AI models.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: NVIDIA: Copyrighted Books Are Just Statistical Correlations to Our AI Models

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In December 2022, music industry giants including BMG, UMG, and Capitol, filed a massive copyright infringement lawsuit against Altice, owners of internet service provider Optimum. The complaint followed the familiar 'repeat infringer' format, with damages for works in suit worth over a billion dollars and everything on the line. A joint filing this week reveals that the lawsuit has been dismissed with prejudice, never to see the light of day again.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Billion Dollar Music Piracy Lawsuit Against Optimum is Over, Permanently

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Larissa Knapp, the MPA's new Chief Content Protection Officer, and the team at ACE have announced the shutdown of several US-based pirate IPTV services. The FBI veteran revealed the closure of AnytimeTV plus other pirate brands, and a settlement with three operators worth over $2m. After appearing to disregard the importance of security, shutting down now may have helped to avoid a larger bill, further down the road.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ACE Shuts US-Based Pirate IPTV Services, Poor Security Costs $2m

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cox Communications has filed a petition at the Supreme Court, requesting a review of a Fourth Circuit ruling that held the company liable for pirating subscribers. While the case is ultimately about service provider liability, the ISP stresses that the current verdict jeopardizes internet access for all Americans, and threatens to cause mass disruption across the internet.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cox Asks Supreme Court to Protect Internet Subscribers from ‘Piracy Terminations’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After years of legal proceedings, New Zealand Justice Minister Paul Goldsmith has approved Kim Dotcom's extradition to the United States. The Megaaupload founder faces criminal copyright infringement, racketeering, and money laundering charges, which in theory could lead to decades in prison. Dotcom says he has a plan and doesn't intend to leave the country.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Kim Dotcom’s Extradition to the U.S. Given Green Light By New Zealand

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In the unlikely event that there's anyone left in the UK who hasn't been completely desensitized to the perils of IPTV, here's another case to strain the nerves. After being raided five years ago, two brothers from Ilford in Essex have been sentenced to prison. Whether both will actually see the inside of a cell is unclear; one turned up to face the music, the other failed to appear. The reason for his absence is unknown and just the start of a long list of other unanswered questions.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Two IPTV Pirates Sentenced to Prison But After 5 Years Questions Remain

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular shadow library LibGen appears to be struggling with technical problems. Regular book downloads stopped working last weekend and remain unavailable. The reason for the issues are unknown but, for now, internal troubles at the site seem more likely than a copyright-related enforcement action.  
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Popular Shadow Library ‘LibGen’ Breaks Down Amidst Legal Troubles

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
File-hosting service Uptobox was taken offline last year following complaints from entertainment industry giants including Amazon, Disney, and StudioCanal. The platform's servers were targeted in a police raid just months after a French court ordered ISPs to block the site. Uptobox tried to reverse this decision, arguing that it's not the piracy haven rightsholders make it out to be, but the court denied that challenge.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Uptobox Bid to Resurrect File-Storage Service Fails in French Court

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Top tier French football leagues, Ligue 1 McDonald's and Ligue 2 BKT, have obtained a new court order to block dozens of pirate IPTV platforms. As presented on the Paris Judicial Court's website, the list of domains amounts to a wall of merged text simply asking to be misinterpreted. Fortunately they're more easily determined in the downloaded order, but that doesn't mean precision blocking won't be needed. Perhaps now more than ever, one mistake could go terribly wrong.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top French Football Leagues Win Pirate IPTV Blocking Orders

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Ecuador's top football league, LigaPro, continues to fight the availability of pirate streaming services. Dozens of 'unauthorized' platforms are active, but MagisTV is seen as the main adversary. To combat this threat, dozens of new IP-addresses were blocked by Internet providers. Meanwhile, rightsholders caught a ball out of left field, successfully opposing a trademark application by MagisTV.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘MagisTV’ Piracy Blocking Efforts in Ecuador Expand, Trademark Application Denied

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
On Russia's answer to YouTube, traffic has doubled in the last 12 months. RuTube is currently awash with pirated copies of Hollywood movies and, during the summer, RuTube used imagery from Barbie and Oppenheimer to advertise the fact. Last week, Russian telecoms operators gave RuTube another boost by massively throttling YouTube. On Friday, RuTube's apps were suddenly removed from Apple's App Store and Google Play.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RuTube Embraces Piracy Then Vanishes From Apple’s App Store & Google Play

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Warner Music Group says it's building a world-class anti-piracy unit. As part of this quest, the company has a job opening for a new anti-piracy coordinator. Prospects will have to spot the latest piracy trends and find sites and services from where the latest leaks originate. Musical talent is not required, but independent and inquisitive prospects, with a strong attention to detail, are preferred. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Warner Music is Looking for an Anti-Piracy Expert to Monitor Leaks

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The title of this article contains a question, one that in various forms has been asked millions of times over the years. The reason the same question still gets asked countless times even today, is simple: the answer, should one even exist, is never true for long, even if we assume it was initially true. So what's the harm in asking?
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: What’s the Safest & Most Trusted Site to Download Pirate Streaming Apps?

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) has repeatedly taken a tough stance on piracy, condemning freeloaders and calling for tough enforcement measures. In a recent earnings call, UFC parent company TKO noted that ESPN price hikes haven't made things easier. On the contrary, the company directly links price increases to the "jacked up" piracy numbers.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UFC Links Increase in Piracy Numbers to ESPN Price Hikes
